compliant.legal provisions: Right to object to processing based on legitimate interests or public interest
Right to erasure (right to be forgotten)

non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should explicitly state the legal basis for processing personal data for marketing purposes, such as consent or legitimate interest. It should also clearly explain how individuals can withdraw their consent to receive marketing communications.

non_compliant.legal provisions: Right of access by the data subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide a clear and accessible method for individuals to access their personal data. It should also specify the timeframe within which the request will be fulfilled.

non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to erasure (right to be forgotten)
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide a clear and accessible method for individuals to request the deletion of their personal data. It should also specify the timeframe within which the request will be fulfilled. The policy should also clearly explain the exceptions to the right to erasure, such as when data is necessary for legal obligations or public interest.

The policy should clearly state the responsibilities of the payment processors in relation to data protection. It should also ensure that the payment processors are bound by appropriate contractual arrangements that comply with GDPR.
